column4: If i find myself soing a bunch of root commands i find it more convenient being root as opposed to "sudo" everything.
Ok, heres a question, how do i disable root then.
Sony's are nothing but problems with linux.
I found that out the hard way.  Ubuntu was my 3rd distro attempt.
however I found Ubuntu succeeded in 95% of where the others failed.
I had a Sony before, they are tricky and not open source friendly, sony is a crappy company.
I would look into loading the audio module manually and see what happens.
I agree with you so far. but the intel 915 chipset shouldn't be too big a problem, another distro installation was using the sound card..
Look for the boot message too, with dmesg
do a lsmod command and see if the module is alreayd loaded.
Open a terminal and type dsp
